title: Ticket #6587: proxy delegation without file transfer
description:
If one submits a job in the vanilla universe that does not use the file transfer mechanism (e.g. jobs on a filesystem mounted on execute nodes), the behavior of use_x509userproxy is not what you might expect. Rather than delegating the proxy to the worker node, the proxy-related variables retain the value they had on the submit node.

Therefore, this scheme only works if one also sets x509userproxy to a location on a filesystem shared between the submit and execute nodes (and create a proxy there). This isn't proxy "delegation" per se, just a shared file.

LIGO would be able to make fairly immediate use of proper proxy delegation in the absence of file transfer mechanisms to access X509-protected data on CVMFS. We consider this one step along the way toward obviating the shared filesystem dependency in many of our workflows.
remarks:
2018-Feb-28 14:44:29 by tpdownes:
I marked v0806 as the "broken" version -- presuambly v1 is literally accurate -- but I presume this to be an 8.7 series feature change.

2018-Apr-26 10:20:57 by tpdownes:
Since Zach is now on this ticket, I'll include a link to our thread on htcondor-users "Submitting and refreshing X509_USER_PROXY"...

https://www-auth.cs.wisc.edu/lists/htcondor-users/2018-April/msg00161.shtml

The "easiest" thing from the user / support perspective is to make use of the impersonation proxy created at login in a manner that predictably survives reboot or logout. And can probably be updated by the user predictably / easily. Whether that ease of support / use is worth it in a larger sense is up for debate, but I appreciate your giving it some thought.

2018-Apr-26 10:24:33 by tpdownes:
Worth adding also that you should place this in the larger context of SciTokens. The data we are accessing over CVMFS that is X509-protected will likely be SciToken-accessed in the future. There will probably be overlap in time for the two technologies, but that transition should feel seamless for our users.

2018-Apr-26 10:56:15 by coatsworth:
We've talked about a couple different ways to implement this.

One way is to push the proxy through the existing file transfer mechanism. When we're evaluating x509userproxy and use_x509userproxy, we also check if we're using file transfer. If we're not, then we bump the proxy onto the file transfer list, and cedar will handle the delegation. This could have some side effects though with filename remaps and working directories which I don't fully understand.

Another option is to implement a new RPC between the shadow and starter explicitly for proxy delegation. This involves more new code. It also means implementing the delegation code in a second place, which I don't love. But overall sounds like a cleaner solution.

Thoughts?

2018-May-02 10:21:29 by tpdownes:
I assume you're asking a developer. :)

2018-May-02 15:34:13 by coatsworth:
Yes I was, just wanted to keep our dev chatter on the public record :) We talked about it and we're moving forward with the RPC approach. I'm actively working on this now so I'll update that in the ticket, stay tuned for updates.

2018-May-30 17:20:43 by coatsworth:
I've got this implemented and ready to go, but since it's security related I'd like to get someone to give it a quick review before I commit to master. Assigning to Jaime. All my changes can be seen here:

https://github.com/htcondor/htcondor/compare/V8_7-gt6587-proxy-delegation

2018-Jun-05 16:28:15 by jfrey:
Code Review

  • JICShadow::initJobInfo()
    • Don't do a D_ALWAYS line for jobs that don't have an x509userproxy. D_FULLDEBUG would be ok, or no log.
  • JICShadow::beginFileTransfer():
    • Don't add new instances of MyString (more of a style choice).
    • Use condor_basename() instead of iterative calls of FindChar().
    • Code assumes ATTR_X509_USER_PROXY will be a full path. Shadow doesn't resolve to full path.
    • Desired proxy expiration time should be obtained using GetDesiredDelegatedJobCredentialExpiration(), not from ATTR_X509_USER_PROXY_EXPIRATION in the job ad.
    • The proxy should be written in the scratch directory under execute, not in the job's iwd.
  • REMOTE_CONDOR_get_delegated_proxy() in starter
    • Do we want the starter to be able to select the source path for the proxy or the expiration time? Would it be better to have shadow enforce these choices?
    • Make the arguments const, change code() to put(), and ditch the strdup()s in the caller.
  • REMOTE_CONDOR_get_delegated_proxy() in shadow
    • proxy_source_path is leaked.

2018-Jun-08 15:53:30 by coatsworth:
  • Starter needs to set the X509_USER_PROXY environment variable to point to the new location of the proxy (in the scratch directory). Look in condor_utils/build_job_env.cpp

2018-Jun-13 11:02:53 by coatsworth:
I've completed all the changes suggested by Jaime. You can view the full contents of my branch on github:

https://github.com/htcondor/htcondor/compare/V8_7-gt6587-proxy-delegation

I want Zach to take a quick look at this before merging it into master, but we should be in good shape to get it in before the 8.7.9 code freeze this Friday.

2018-Jun-15 16:38:40 by jfrey:
Code Review

In the latest code:

  • In JICShadow::beginFileTransfer(), call GetDesiredDelegatedJobCredentialExpiration() for the desired proxy expiration time. Do not look up ATTR_X509_USER_PROXY_EXPIRATION in the job ad.

2018-Sep-14 16:07:28 by tpdownes:
How should I be testing this? I have submitted the following job 
request_cpus = 1
request_memory = 100M
executable = /bin/sleep
transfer_executable = False
should_transfer_files = no
use_x509userproxy = True
arguments = 300
universe = vanilla
Error = checksum-$(ClusterId).err
Output = checksum-$(ClusterId).out
Log = checksum-$(ClusterId).log
accounting_group = cgca.condor
accounting_group_user = thomas.downes
notification = never
notify_user = thomas.downes@ligo.org
Queue 1

I've run variants with md5sum trying to access X509-protected data in /cvmfs but boiled it down to something simple/portable. If I then run condor_ssh_to_job, I can look at the proxy info but it's pointing to a file that doesn't exist: 

[execute3022:cvmfs-proxy-testing] echo $X509_USER_PROXY
/localscratch/condor/execute/dir_249011/x509up_p3442.fileslqq6V.1
[execute3022:cvmfs-proxy-testing] ls -lha /localscratch/condor/execute/dir_249011/
total 44K
drwx------ 3 tpdownes    7 Sep 14 16:07 ./
drwxr-xr-x 6 condor      6 Sep 14 16:06 ../
-rwx------ 1 tpdownes   48 Sep 14 16:06 .chirp.config*
drwxr-xr-x 2 tpdownes    9 Sep 14 16:06 .condor_ssh_to_job_1/
-rw-r--r-- 1 condor   4.0K Sep 14 16:06 .job.ad
-rw-r--r-- 1 condor   7.8K Sep 14 16:06 .machine.ad
-rw-r--r-- 1 tpdownes 8.0K Sep 14 16:07 .update.ad

2018-Sep-14 16:11:40 by tpdownes:
I also note that repeated submissions of the job all result in the same target filename (x509up_p3442.fileslqq6V.1) for the proxy. Since it appears at least somewhat intended to be randomized, I don't know if this is a problem.

2018-Sep-17 13:49:17 by coatsworth:
Hi Tom, we designed this with the expectation you'll also include a full path to the x509 proxy in your submit file using the *x509userproxy* attribute. For example:

use_x509userproxy = True
x509userproxy = /tmp/x509up_u21047

Is that a reasonable expectation? I'm not deeply familiar with x509 so I don't know if there's a way we can automatically determine the path. For now, you need to include it.

EDIT: The above is wrong. There's some additional machinery in condor_submit I wasn't aware of that sets default values here if needed. As jfrey indicates below, setting just one of use_x509userproxy and x509userproxy is sufficient.

2018-Sep-17 14:59:48 by tpdownes:
I have explicitly set x509userproxy to the location of my proxy without apparent help. In each case, grid-proxy-info will point me to a file on the execute node that simply doesn't exit. The behavior does not seem to be dependent on any of the following:

  • Debian 8 or 9 packages (figured 9 might have been a pre-release)
  • The value of transfer_executable
  • The value of should_transfer_files
  • Whether x509userproxy is a "end entity credential" or a "RFC 3820 compliant impersonation proxy"

2018-Sep-17 15:53:32 by jfrey:
Setting just one of use_x509userproxy and x509userproxy should be sufficient. I just did a quick test on a couple of machines at UW and it's working as expected there.

2018-Sep-17 15:55:41 by tpdownes:
Please define "expected" and give me an example submit file that demonstrates it.

2018-Sep-17 16:07:45 by jfrey:
On my submit machine, I have a proxy in /tmp/my.proxy, and X509_USER_PROXY is set to that filename in my environment.

Here's my submit file: 

universe=vanilla
executable=job.sh
arguments=5
output = out.$(Cluster).$(Process)
error = err.$(Cluster).$(Process)
should_transfer_files = NO
notification = NEVER
use_x509userproxy = true
queue

When my job runs, the following are set in the environment: 

_CONDOR_SCRATCH_DIR=/Users/jfrey/condor/test/execute/dir_65102
X509_USER_PROXY=/Users/jfrey/condor/test/execute/dir_65102/my.proxy

And these are the contents of the job's scratch directory: 

% ls -la /Users/jfrey/condor/test/execute/dir_65102
total 48
drwx------  6 jfrey  staff   192 Sep 17 16:01 .
drwxr-xr-x  3 jfrey  staff    96 Sep 17 16:01 ..
-rwx------  1 jfrey  staff    48 Sep 17 16:01 .chirp.config
-rw-r--r--  1 jfrey  staff  3755 Sep 17 16:01 .job.ad
-rw-r--r--  1 jfrey  staff  5761 Sep 17 16:01 .machine.ad
-rw-------  1 jfrey  staff  4996 Sep 17 16:01 my.proxy

2018-Sep-18 15:57:15 by coatsworth:
We've confirmed there was a bug related to file system permissions when running the condor daemons as root. It's consistent with what's being described here and the likely cause of this problem. I've applied a fix that will be included in v8.7.10.

2018-Sep-19 12:46:04 by tpdownes:
Any chance I can get a pre-release .deb to install on an execute node? Or just a condor_starter binary for Debian 8 or 9?

I'm in the mood (i.e. I have time) to provide feedback now but that may change by the time 8.7.10 is released.

2018-Sep-19 15:08:14 by coatsworth:
Your best bet for a Debian pre-release is just to download a results package off our build and test dashboard. Here's a link to a recent one:

http://submit-3.batlab.org/nmi-runs/condorauto/2018/09/condorauto_submit-3.batlab.org_1537352521_268223/userdir/nmi:x86_64_Debian9/results.tar.gz

You'll find .deb files in the /public folder. There are also pre-built binaries in the .tar.gz files in the same folder.

Please keep us posted how it goes!

2018-Sep-19 15:35:45 by tpdownes:
I can confirm that this test job yields a delegated proxy that is observable with condor_ssh_to_job. In the absence of delegate_job_GSI_credentials_lifetime, it defaults to 24h, as expected. 

request_cpus = 1
request_memory = 100M
executable = /bin/sleep
transfer_executable = False
should_transfer_files = never
use_x509userproxy = True
delegate_job_GSI_credentials_lifetime = 0
arguments = 300
universe = vanilla
Error = checksum-$(ClusterId).err
Output = checksum-$(ClusterId).out
Log = checksum-$(ClusterId).log
Requirements = Machine == "execute3091.nemo.uwm.edu" # with the pre-release .deb
accounting_group = cgca.condor
accounting_group_user = thomas.downes
notification = never
notify_user = thomas.downes@ligo.org
Queue 1

A more interesting job (that will fail for non-LIGO members) 

request_cpus = 1
request_memory = 100M
executable = /usr/bin/sha512sum
transfer_executable = False
should_transfer_files = never
use_x509userproxy = True
delegate_job_GSI_credentials_lifetime = 0
arguments = /cvmfs/ligo.osgstorage.org/frames/O2/hoft_C02_clean/H1/H-H1_CLEANED_HOFT_C02-11851/H-H1_CLEANED_HOFT_C02-1185168682-4096.gwf
universe = vanilla
Error = checksum-$(ClusterId).err
Output = checksum-$(ClusterId).out
Log = checksum-$(ClusterId).log
Requirements = Machine == "execute3091.nemo.uwm.edu"
accounting_group = cgca.condor
accounting_group_user = thomas.downes
notification = never
notify_user = thomas.downes@ligo.org
Queue 1

Success! 

[submit:cvmfs-proxy-testing] cat checksum-323358.out
52e4931392688e119f7afe4ba6a1c7c59dc797270570c5b753918346faeb66c16b22adea42204d2caa7b1ef3fe1b80bda44b5bd637cfe611934656a691779389  /cvmfs/ligo.osgstorage.org/frames/O2/hoft_C02_clean/H1/H-H1_CLEANED_HOFT_C02-11851/H-H1_CLEANED_HOFT_C02-1185168682-4096.gwf

2018-Sep-19 15:50:48 by tpdownes:
A question about behavior of long-lived workflows. A typical LIGO user will run ligo-proxy-init on his/her workstation and have an "end entity credential" available to them. ligo-proxy-init is just grid-proxy-init that grabs a short-lived cert from the CILogon service. 

➜  ~ grid-proxy-info
subject  : /DC=org/DC=cilogon/C=US/O=LIGO/CN=Thomas Downes thomas.downes@ligo.org
issuer   : /DC=org/DC=cilogon/C=US/O=CILogon/CN=CILogon Basic CA 1
identity : /DC=org/DC=cilogon/C=US/O=LIGO/CN=Thomas Downes thomas.downes@ligo.org
type     : end entity credential
strength : 2048 bits
path     : /tmp/x509up_u562182957
timeleft : 149:06:25  (6.2 days)

Upon =gsissh=-based login to a submit node, they have an impersonation proxy 

[submit:cvmfs-proxy-testing] grid-proxy-info
subject  : /DC=org/DC=cilogon/C=US/O=LIGO/CN=Thomas Downes thomas.downes@ligo.org/CN=1164443017
issuer   : /DC=org/DC=cilogon/C=US/O=LIGO/CN=Thomas Downes thomas.downes@ligo.org
identity : /DC=org/DC=cilogon/C=US/O=LIGO/CN=Thomas Downes thomas.downes@ligo.org
type     : RFC 3820 compliant impersonation proxy
strength : 2048 bits
path     : /tmp/x509up_p44153.fileEKzxlI.1
timeleft : 149:06:12  (6.2 days)

The impersonation proxy is deleted upon logout. See this thread for a discussion:

https://www-auth.cs.wisc.edu/lists/htcondor-users/2018-April/msg00179.shtml

I'd wager the behavior we should expect is for the jobs that match after logout to fail.

This is not the end of the world -- it basically means running ligo-proxy-init on the submit node -- but it's a thing we'll have to force users to do.

Could DELEGATE_FULL_JOB_GSI_CREDENTIALS help us detect when the user only has an impersonation proxy?

2018-Sep-19 16:45:32 by jfrey:
DELEGATE_FULL_JOB_GSI_CREDENTIALS only affects what kind of proxy is created on the execute node, an "impersonation proxy" or a "limited proxy". Condor doesn't care what kind of credential is used on the submit machine to do the delegation. As you show with ligo-proxy-init, the source credential doesn't have to be a proxy. The issue is the lifetime of the file containing the credential.

2018-Sep-19 16:48:56 by tpdownes:
I may be able to solve the lifetime issue with GSSAPICleanupCredentials in /etc/gsissh/sshd_config. I'll discuss the tradeoffs on the LIGO side.

I think we should call this victory in the context of X509, but I understand that Zach's work includes surviving planned/unplanned logout/reboot by copying the credentials to a store at time of submission.

(where "credentials" means more modern forms of credentials)
